tweets.text: This poor lady pregnant with complications & vomiting due to inhaling landfill gas in her own home. I‚Äôm an incredulous that @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland seem incapable of tying their own shoes let alone taking responsibility and shutting the damn place.our outrage will get louder https://t.co/w8ta0nHYnK

@SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @PHE_EoEngland We're 1.2 miles away and it's unbearable. I am breathing it in as we speak. I'm considering getting a purifier but they're really expensive and the burden shouldn't be on us: it shouldn't be an issue and we shouldn't be subjected to this poor level of air quality [1/2]

I grew up living a few hundred metres from a landfill site in Sneyd Green in the 1990s and I don't remember ever even smelling anything from it, let alone being unwell. @RedIndustries2 maybe you could take some tips from how they did it in the olden days #stopthestink  @EnvAgency

Much more than a nuisance odour (although that‚Äôs bad enough)- a thick dense gas invading homes frequently & causing health effects & great distress to the community . The @EnvAgency should be held to account for their ineffective regulation of the perpetrators  @StinkStopthe https://t.co/CdTG3E03c9

tweets.text: @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @PHE_EoEngland You're so right. The people who have organised the campaigns and the community generally have been kind, supportive, and tireless in their advocacy and solidarity. I'll also be donating what I can afford and keep praying that an end to this horrendous situation is in sight [2/2]

'She said it was that bad last night she woke nearly being sick and was that scared she went to check on her three young daughters to make sure they were still breathing. Because she felt like they were being suffocated. It's breaking my heart'

And what effect is that having on her mentally as well, it‚Äôs totally unacceptable. I regularly check on my son in the night when it‚Äôs in the house. It‚Äôs frightening @MattHancock @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @PHE_EoEngland https://t.co/f6pc0UNsre

tweets.text: On the infamous big weekend stink of @RedIndustries2 Walley‚Äôs Quarry,the @EnvAgencyMids received thousands of complaints to their emergency number. No one came out and no data was collected.That tells you everything you need to know about the effectiveness of the EA.#stopthestink https://t.co/Tc3t6CrWb9

Why does the @EnvAgency promote these lies, last year on the @RiverChess we had 52 days when we had sewage discharges that had absolutely nothing to do with storm events. This year already we've had 70 days of sewage discharges that had absolutely nothing to do with storm events https://t.co/DiHw6dO6uY

Rather curiously there hasn't been a single Tweet from the @EnvAgency in the last 24 hours bragging about how they 'Enhance", the environment.

https://t.co/WaaFQXr1lZ

Our real-time alerts of #sewage spills into the river from 6 locations around Oxford are now live. They can be viewed here @OxThamesSewage. For more info, view https://t.co/WhAukv4x99 https://t.co/b6Vz7LfQ1T

Our peatland restoration work has to come to an end for the year to make way for bird nesting. 
We are expecting to see the arrival of ....
Golden Plover
Curlews
Skylarks
Wheatears
Meadow Pippets
@cumbriawildlife @EnvAgency @unitedutilities https://t.co/1McgnCpKLk

These shocking health impacts in relation to Walley's Quarry Landfill, Newcastle-under-Lyme. In 21st century. Now, in fact. Needs sorting FAST @MattHancock @EnvAgency @AaronBell4NUL @BBCPanorama @davidshukmanbbc @guardianeco @dpcarrington @StinkStopthe     #StopTheStink https://t.co/Jilk9HV0YC

@a_merrydew @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @PHE_EoEngland We are 2m away so don‚Äôt know how on earth the people living by it cope.We are getting an air purifier this weekend&donating money for ones for people closer.Chaps organising it are kind,thoughtful- a stark contrast to the wickedness&greed causing this @StinkStopthe @StinkStopthe

@CRTYorkshireNE 
Mill Dike would benefit from some overdue maintenance at #Bentley #Doncaster. Photos show just how much width Mill Dike has lost due to the slip of the embankment. This is a major area of flooding, sandbags just removed @MyDoncaster @EnvAgency  #Doncasterisgreat https://t.co/GoZIpwdR6l

@StinkStopthe @SkyNews @BBCNews @itvnews @Channel4News In this day &  age it‚Äôs criminal and it‚Äôs criminal that‚Äôs it‚Äôs not been reported Nationally @AaronBell4NUL @MattHancock @pow_rebecca  @EnvAgency @PHE_uk #stopthestink

tweets.text: @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @PHE_EoEngland I've just seen your tweet about having to increase your inhalers. How worrying and completely unacceptable. I am so sorry you and 1000s of people, animal, and the environment are being put at high risk on a daily basis.

@HelenVi00175623 @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @PHE_uk @JeremyVineOn5 @BBCNews @Matthew_Wright @DrHilaryJones @DrRanj @JohnDCaudwell It was horrendous this morning one of the worst nights, all through the house! Was literally sick this morning. I live a mile away @ITVCentral @BBCWatchdog

tweets.text: @gaganmohindra Why do we need a Taskforce?  Isn‚Äôt the solution simply to properly fund a regulator who can ensure existing laws are not broken?

@a_merrydew @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe All reported to GP and PHE and GP is sending a separate letter to PHE about it. 2 lots of inhalers 4 weeks ago and now an oral tablet. It‚Äôs not good enough. It‚Äôs getting too big now, the authorities need to act @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland

Health and Environmental Risks of Residents Living Close to a Landfill: ‚Å¶@RedIndustries2‚Å© ‚Å¶@MattHancock‚Å© ‚Å¶@AaronBell4NUL‚Å© ‚Å¶@PHE_uk‚Å© ‚Å¶@StinkStopthe‚Å© . Another night affected by the poison and smell seeping in our homes  https://t.co/seMRp64tb6
@a_merrydew @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe Lots of info saying you can become desensitised to hydrogen sulphide and it‚Äôs a worrying sign if that happens! üò¨
Hi @SimonTagg, has the @EnvAgency shared any data from the monitoring units at #walleysquarry with #nulbc yet? #stopthestink

@SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe It might be that it's not getting into the house today. It only faintly got into mine yesterday, which was welcome respite. I'm not sure we can become desensitised ü§¢ I'm sorry you've got throat & chest issues. If you haven't already, it's worth reporting symptoms to your GP.

Never in my life in the UK did I think fresh air would be a luxury but this is our life now in #newcastleunderlyme A family member has taken me to get the freshest air because where I live cant provide us with that anymore.

@EnvAgencyMids @BBCPanorama @StinkStopthe #STOPTHESTINK https://t.co/Dv2UXf6ZbA
